comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Joaquim Carlos Paiva de Andrada (1846-1928), Portuguese military man, administrator and explorer in Mozambique: pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joaquim_Carlos_Paiva_de_Andrada

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: No clues yet as to what brought him to the United States. books.google.com/books?id=_G1-nXEv7REC&pg=PA102&l... Lonely Planet's guide to Mozambique (by Mary Fitzpatrick) has a paragraph about him as explorer and entrepreneur. Two of his descriptions of his explorations have been transcribed by Project Gutenberg (in Portuguese, of course) onlinebooks.library.upenn.edu/webbin/gutbook/author?name=...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: He is listed as having sailed from New York on Feb. 27, 1915 on the Lusitania to Liverpool, which matches with the Lusitania shots just prior to this in the Bain news flow. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B06EFDC1238E633A...
